item.title: Rewriting Recoil from scratch
item.description: A brief exploration into how to build an "atom" based state management library like Recoil. I talk about how I'd build atoms, selectors as well as the hooks to use them from React. What's more - it's all in under 100 lines of code.

item.title: Building a JavaScript-free fast static site
item.description: How to build a blazingly fast static site without relying on Gatsby or JavaScript. I talk about common features of websites that make them slow and give tips on how to build a purely static site that meets all the Core Web Vitals.

item.title: Don't use boxed trait objects
item.description: Boxed trait objects are a great scape goat for solving hard borrow checker errors. But when writing a struct that needs to be reused, you're better off using something else for their interior structure.

item.title: Safe, efficient and fast native Node extensions with Rust
item.description: Everyone seems to be rewriting all their JavaScript in Rust. I look at how you can use Rust, Rayon and Neon to write user fast and parallel native Node extensions.

item.title: Vim for Webdev
item.description: I've been using the Vim emulator for Visual Studio Code for a really long time. In this one I finally look at how to make the switch to Neovim but keep all the perks of using a full fledged web development IDE.

item.title: Force push your branches
item.description: A slightly hyperbolic argument for why you should force push your branches. I look at how force pushing helps you to keep your git history readable and free of merge commits.

item.title: Advanced beginner Vim tricks
item.description: After you get past the beginner level in Vim it can be a bit hard to figure out what to learn next. To help, I explore some tips and tricks to help you overcome the valley of despair and become an advanced Vim user.

item.title: Learning Rust through the Advent of Code
item.description: An introduction to the Rust programming language through an Advent of Code 2018 challenge.

item.title: Leaving i3 and Xorg for Sway and Wayland
item.description: A brief journey into leaving behind Xorg and i3 for the newer Wayland compositor and Sway window manager. I talk about a few issues I ran into during the migration and how I (tried) to fix them.

item.title: Japanese Fonts on Arch Linux
item.description: How to get Japanese fonts working properly on Arch Linux. I look at how to configure the default system fonts as well as getting Japanese input working with Fcitx and Mozc.
